results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.brief_description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
description_for_label: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.

results.title: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White
results.brief_description: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.
results.title_for_label: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White
results.description: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.
description_for_label: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Pat Vines joined the Australian Navy as a nurse during World War II. She moved up the ranks and eventually became a Commander. Pat tells her story through her memories of wartime and what it was like to work in the Navy.
results.description: Pat Vines joined the Australian Navy as a nurse during World War II. She moved up the ranks and eventually became a Commander. Pat tells her story through her memories of wartime and what it was like to work in the Navy.
description_for_label: Pat Vines joined the Australian Navy as a nurse during World War II. She moved up the ranks and eventually became a Commander. Pat tells her story through her memories of wartime and what it was like to work in the Navy.

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines: The Shrine of Remembrance
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: After Pat Vines returns from the war as a Commander of the Australian Navy, one of her senior navy officers recommends her to the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees, which she joins. She tells of her time as a Trustee for the Shrine.
results.title_for_label: An Interview with Pat Vines: The Shrine of Remembrance
results.description: After Pat Vines returns from the war as a Commander of the Australian Navy, one of her senior navy officers recommends her to the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees, which she joins. She tells of her time as a Trustee for the Shrine.
description_for_label: After Pat Vines returns from the war as a Commander of the Australian Navy, one of her senior navy officers recommends her to the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees, which she joins. She tells of her time as a Trustee for the Shrine.

results.title: An Interview with Douglas McLean
results.creator_credit: Douglas McLean and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas McLean tells of how he was called up when war was declared and his posting to the 39th Brigade. He covers his years of service as well as fighting the Japanese in the Pacific.
results.description: Douglas McLean tells of how he was called up when war was declared and his posting to the 39th Brigade. He covers his years of service as well as fighting the Japanese in the Pacific.
description_for_label: Douglas McLean tells of how he was called up when war was declared and his posting to the 39th Brigade. He covers his years of service as well as fighting the Japanese in the Pacific.

results.title: The Lucky years
results.creator_credit: Brian Luscombe and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Brian Luscombe enlisted in the Air Force on Australia Day 1942. He was 18 and wanted to be a pilot. Dubbed Lucky Luscombe, Brian talks about his years as a pilot in the RAAF in World War II.
results.description: Brian Luscombe enlisted in the Air Force on Australia Day 1942. He was 18 and wanted to be a pilot. Dubbed Lucky Luscombe, Brian talks about his years as a pilot in the RAAF in World War II.
description_for_label: Brian Luscombe enlisted in the Air Force on Australia Day 1942. He was 18 and wanted to be a pilot. Dubbed Lucky Luscombe, Brian talks about his years as a pilot in the RAAF in World War II.

results.title: The Letters from Java
results.brief_description: Eric Peters only knew his dad through what records were left behind. They were mostly letters that came through the censors at a POW camp in Burma and old photos. He reflects on the sadness of not knowing his dad and the importance of bringing his spirit home to rest.
results.description: Eric Peters only knew his dad through what records were left behind. They were mostly letters that came through the censors at a POW camp in Burma and old photos. He reflects on the sadness of not knowing his dad and the importance of bringing his spirit home to rest.

results.title: Compression
results.brief_description: Ricky Morris is the 21st member of his family to see active service for Australia. He is proud to be part of the fighting Gunditjmarra people. His story looks at the invisible pressures modern soldiers constantly face and his realisation that this was shared by his family waiting for him at home.
